meanings.definition: To surround a place with armed forces in order to capture it or force its surrender.
meanings.sent1: The army sieged the castle to take control of it.
meanings.sent2: The enemy sieged the town, cutting off all supply routes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels sieged the bird feeder, determined to get to the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm sieged the coastline, battering it with strong winds and high waves.
meanings.sent5: The students sieged the library during finals week, searching for study materials.

meanings.definition: To subject to a siege; besiege.
meanings.sent1: The general sieged the enemy stronghold, cutting off their communication lines.
meanings.sent2: The rebels sieged the government building, demanding political change.
meanings.sent3: The cat sieged the mouse hole, waiting patiently for its prey to emerge.
meanings.sent4: The darkness sieged the room, enveloping everything in shadows.
meanings.sent5: The vines sieged the old house, reclaiming it from human hands.
